main event: On December 8, 1967, observers in Springfield, Ohio reported seeing a large, bright, orange, circular self-luminous object that circled their location for approximately two minutes.
interesting points: The sighting included three witnesses who are certain of their observations,The object was described as having a hue consistent with a hot air balloon under certain conditions,The phenomenon changed in visibility from one object to two, then back to one during the sighting,The object appeared to move silently and rapidly with no physical evidence left behind,The sighting was a probable explanation of a hot air balloon due to weather conditions at the time.
sighted object: a large, bright, orange circular object
witness description: The witnesses described the object as circular and self-luminous, with a prominent orange color.
